summary: This video discusses an art installation titled 'Old People's Home,' created by Sun Yuan and Peng Yu in 2007. The installation is currently on display at the 'The World As It Goes' exhibition in Paris, hosted by the Borster Commerce Pinot Collections. The artwork features 13 realistic sculptures of elderly individuals (OAPs) who resemble prominent world leaders, dictators, politicians, religious figures, and military leaders from recent history. These figures are depicted in electric wheelchairs, symbolizing a loss of power and control due to aging. The video emphasizes how these once-powerful individuals are now reduced to slow-moving, vulnerable states, highlighting themes of mortality, decline, and the passage of time.
